sent: The Met Office has issued a weather warning as freezing fog and icy conditions are expected to hit various parts of the country.
Untreated roads and pavements are likely to be very slippery as temperatures drop sharply overnight, with some rural areas seeing temperatures fall to -3 degrees Celsius.
There is also the risk of freezing fog patches in some areas.
Motorists and pedestrians are advised to take extra precautions and allow for extra travel time as the icy conditions could lead to hazardous driving and walking conditions.
It is recommended to drive at reduced speeds and increase following distances to avoid accidents.

Local authorities are preparing gritters to treat roads and ensure safer driving conditions, but individuals are urged to be vigilant and take necessary measures to stay safe during this period of inclement weather.
Residents are advised to dress warmly and be cautious when venturing outdoors, especially during the early morning and late evening when temperatures are at their lowest.
Keeping updated with weather forecasts and heeding any further warnings from authorities is crucial to staying safe during this challenging weather period.
Is Westworld on Netflix?
Fans of the hit sci-fi series Westworld may be wondering if they can catch up on all the action and intrigue by streaming the show on Netflix.
Unfortunately, as of now, Westworld is not available on Netflix in the UK.

Based on the 1973 film of the same name, Westworld is written and directed by celebrated novelist Michael Crichton and centres around a futuristic wild west-themed adventure experience park populated by "hosts" who are there to serve the every need and desire of the wealthy paying guests.
However, as is often the case in such dystopian visions, everything is not always as it first may seem...
The show has a strong cast including Anthony Hopkins, Evan Rachel Wood, Ed Harris, Thandie Newton and Jeffrey Wright to name but a few.

Made by American premium cable giant HBO (who also make sci-fi fantasy behemoth Game of Thrones), Westworld is currently available in the UK on Sky Atlantic and can only be streamed via Sky Go (available to Sky subscribers) and on NOW TV.
The show is NOT currently available on Netflix in the UK.
Former Olympian, John Backer, was handed a 13-month jail sentence today after being found guilty of fraud.
The three-time Olympian had been facing two charges of fraud over $5,000 and had pleaded not guilty on both counts.
Judge Carmen Rogers also gave the former investment dealer three years of probation.
In an agreed statement of facts, Backer promised to pay restitution of $161,900 to five people.
In a thrilling showdown, North Dakota State emerged victorious over their rivals North Dakota with a final score of 88-79, showcasing their dominance with an impressive 60% shooting accuracy.
The Bison's stellar performance on the court left the Fighting Hawks struggling to keep up throughout the game.
The game started off with North Dakota State taking an early lead, setting the tone for the match.
The Bison's sharp shooting skills were on full display as they maintained a solid lead over their opponents.
Despite the Fighting Hawks' best efforts to narrow the gap, North Dakota State's consistent scoring and strong defense proved to be too much to overcome.
As the game progressed, the intensity heightened with both teams delivering standout performances.
The Fighting Hawks managed to mount a comeback with an 18-5 rally, momentarily closing in on their opponents.
However, North Dakota State swiftly responded with a 10-3 run to secure a 44-37 lead at halftime.
The Bison's offensive prowess continued in the second half, with key players like Tyson Ward and A.J.
Jacobson leading the charge.
Despite a valiant effort from North Dakota, highlighted by standout performances from Marlon Stewart and Geno Crandall, the Bison maintained their lead until the final buzzer.
The Fighting Hawks put together an 18-5 rally to trim the deficit to a point before North Dakota state ended the half with a 10-3 run and led 44-37 at intermission.
The Bison shot 17 of 29 from the field including 7 for 13 from 3-point range.
Geno Crandall later made a layup, a jumpshot and a 3-pointer in succession to close the deficit to 59-58 but North Dakota never got closer.
Tyson Wards scored 15 points for the Bison and A.J.
Jacobson had 12.
Marlon Stewart led North Dakota with 23, Crandall, 20 and Conner Avants and Kienan Walter each scored 11.
North Dakota leads the all-time series 160-134.
DAYTON, Ohio (WDTN) – The Dayton Police Department said an oil slick was found on a Dayton bridge Monday evening and called a hazmat crew to the scene.
Police received the call around 6:11 p.m. and crews started to look around on the Stewart Street Bridge in Dayton.
Crews are still out on the bridge investigating this case.
The discovery of the oil slick has raised concerns about potential environmental impact and the source of the spill.
The hazmat crew is working to contain and clean up the oil, while also assessing any risks to the surrounding area and waterways.
Authorities are urging caution for commuters using the bridge and advising the public to stay clear of the affected area until further notice.
Local residents are advised to report any unusual activities or sightings near the bridge to the authorities to assist in the ongoing investigation.
Further updates on the situation are expected as the investigation progresses.
Los Angeles Dodgers third baseman Justin Turner suffered a broken left wrist after being hit by a pitch during a Spring Training game.
The incident occurred in the first inning of the Dodgers' matchup against the Oakland Athletics.
Turner, a key player in the Dodgers' lineup, was hit by a Kendall Graveman pitch, causing the injury.
This unfortunate setback leaves the Dodgers without one of their star players as the regular season approaches.
Turner, known for his power at the plate and defensive skills, was expected to play a crucial role in the team's success this season.
Turner was slated to bat third in the Dodgers' lineup, following a strong performance in the previous season where he hit 21 home runs and boasted an impressive slash line.
As of now, there is no clear timetable for Turner's return, leaving fans and the team concerned about his absence.
Turner was hit by a Kendall Graveman pitch in the first inning of the Dodgers' 3-1 win over the Oakland Athletics.
There is no timetable yet for Turner's return.
Slated to bat third in Los Angeles' lineup this season, Turner is coming off a 2017 season in which he hit 21 homers and produced a slash line of .322/.415/.530.
Turner is in the second year of a four-year, $64 million deal with the Dodgers.
The University of Wisconsin has successfully landed a transfer, adding depth and talent to its football roster.
The latest addition to the Badgers is former Katy High School standout, James Wilder.
The 3-star recruit from Katy, Texas, has decided to continue his collegiate career with Wisconsin after exploring his options.
Standing at 5-foot-11 and weighing 195 pounds, Wilder brings a combination of speed and agility to the team.
Despite having an offer from the Badgers initially, he ultimately chose to make the move away from home.
Wilder will be redshirting this season due to NCAA transfer rules but will have two years of eligibility remaining to make an impact on the field.
The Badgers coaching staff is excited to welcome Wilder and looks forward to seeing his contributions in the seasons to come.
A 3-star recruit coming out of Katy, Texas, the 5-foot-11, 195-pound Wilder had an offer from the Badgers but ended up staying close to home.
Wilder will have to sit out this season, but will have two years of eligibility remaining.

Columbus, Ohio - In a dramatic water rescue, Columbus Police officers saved a 12-year-old boy from a potentially life-threatening situation at a pond near Victory Drive.
The incident unfolded when Officer Jim Wilder responded to a call about a child wandering near the pond, exhibiting signs of distress.
Upon arriving at the scene, Officer Wilder noticed the child running towards a nearby residential area.
As more officers rushed to the location, the boy entered the water at the 5000 block of Victory Drive.
Without hesitation, Officer Wilder and Officer Tony Kummer sprang into action, entering the water equipped with flotation bags.
Risking their own safety, the officers navigated the pond's waters and successfully retrieved the child, bringing him to safety.
Miraculously, the boy emerged from the water unharmed, thanks to the swift and decisive actions of the Columbus Police Department.
"The quick actions of our officers prevented what could have been a tragic situation," stated Lt. Matt Harris, the public relations officer for the Columbus Police Department.
The successful rescue underscored the importance of the rigorous training that CPD officers undergo, particularly in handling situations involving individuals with special needs.
This heartwarming story serves as a reminder of the bravery and dedication exhibited by law enforcement officers in protecting and serving their communities.
He observed the child a short time later running toward a nearby residential area.
Additional officers arrived as the child entered a retaining pond near the 5000 block of Victory Drive moments later.
Wilder and Officer Tony Kummer entered the water with flotation bags and were able to bring the child safely out of the water.
The boy was unharmed.

The German state of Bavaria has recently issued an order for crosses to be mounted at government buildings, sparking a debate over the separation of church and state.
Crosses are already compulsory in public schools and courtrooms in predominantly Catholic Bavaria.

The governing Christian Social Union — the Bavaria-only wing of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s party — is hoping to avoid losing its state majority to Alternative for Germany, a party on the right whose anti-Muslim campaigns have struck a chord with some German voters.
Critics of the decision argue that it blurs the line between religion and politics, while supporters view it as a reaffirmation of the state's Christian heritage.
The move is seen as a strategic political move ahead of upcoming elections, with parties vying for support from different segments of the population.
The debate surrounding the presence of crosses in government buildings is likely to continue as different groups express their opinions on the matter.
The Lady Buffs showcased their dominance on the diamond as they bullied the Lady Bulldogs in a commanding performance last night.
Forsan's softball team displayed exceptional teamwork and skill, outplaying their opponents in every aspect of the game.
The Lady Buffs' strong offense was on full display, with powerful hits and strategic baserunning leading to numerous runs throughout the game.
Led by standout performances from Hannah Williams, Avery Tigert, and Taylyn Still, Forsan took an early lead and never looked back.
The Lady Buffs' solid defense and pitching also played a crucial role in shutting down the Lady Bulldogs' offense, limiting them to only three hits in the entire game.
The Lady Buffs outhit the Bulldogs 13 to 3 in the game and showed great plate discipline all game.
Forsan got on the board early on a double by Hannah Williams, a stolen base by Avery Tigert, a single by Taylyn Still, a double by Kayla Morin, and an error in the second inning.
Forsan looked impressive in every phase last night.
With those sticks at the plate and the great leadership and play provided by Still and Pearson, the Lady Buffs look poised to make some waves in the post season.
They will get their chance Thursday in Pecos when they face off against Anthony for bi-district bragging rights.
For full story, see Tuesday's edition of the Herald.
OAKLAND, Calif. — Veterans Mike Callahan and Ken Mauer, along with first-timer David Guthrie, are among the 12 referees who have been selected to work the NBA Finals.
The league announced the group Wednesday.
Callahan, a highly respected official with extensive playoff experience, has officiated multiple NBA Finals in his career.
Mauer, known for his consistency and professionalism on the court, brings a wealth of knowledge to the officiating crew.
Guthrie, making his Finals debut, has quickly earned a reputation for his sharp eye and fair calls.
The trio will be joined by a talented group of referees who have demonstrated their skills throughout the season.
The NBA Finals promise to be fiercely contested, and having experienced officials like Callahan and Mauer will ensure the games are officiated at the highest level.
Fans can expect a fair and competitive series with this distinguished group of referees at the helm.

The New York Mets have finalized a one-year deal worth $3 million with veteran relief pitcher Fernando Salas.
This signing marks a return for Salas to the Mets, where he previously played in the 2016 and 2017 seasons.
The 32-year-old right-hander brings experience and depth to the Mets' bullpen as they prepare for the upcoming season.
Salas is known for his reliable performance on the mound and his ability to pitch in various situations.
With a career ERA of 3.91 and over 500 innings pitched in the majors, Salas adds a valuable asset to the Mets' pitching staff.
The team is optimistic about his contributions and leadership both on and off the field as they aim for success in the upcoming season.
At the AWS re:Invent 2017 event, Amazon Web Services unveiled a groundbreaking development with the introduction of Amazon EC2 Bare Metal Instances.
This new offering provides customers with the flexibility to run workloads directly on physical servers, combining the benefits of cloud computing with the performance of bare metal infrastructure.
With this innovation, users can harness the power of EC2 instances while retaining full control over the underlying hardware.
The launch of Amazon EC2 Bare Metal Instances marks a significant milestone in cloud computing, catering to a wide range of use cases and demanding workloads.
Learn more about Amazon EC2 at – http://amzn.to/2iaUOwu This video is from the fine folks at Amazon Web Services (AWS).

Despite improvements in labor markets around the world, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) has highlighted that these positive developments have not yet led to significant wage gains.
“The improvements in labor markets have yet to translate into significant and broad-based wage gains.

Comprehensive structural reforms are needed to sustain stronger growth beyond the cyclical upswing, create more and better paying jobs, improve opportunities and strengthen inclusion.” Credit: OECD While the Paris-based institution highlighted reforms in Greece, Italy, France, Japan, India and Argentina over the past year, it noted that overall “the pace of reforms has remained similar to the relatively slow pace observed in the last two years and below the one observed in the direct aftermath of the crisis.”
However, it also pointed out that overall progress in implementing these reforms has been relatively slow.
The OECD noted that the pace of reforms has remained similar to the relatively slow pace observed in the last two years and below the one observed in the direct aftermath of the crisis.

As countries continue to navigate economic challenges and work towards fostering inclusive growth, the OECD's call for comprehensive structural reforms serves as a reminder of the importance of addressing underlying issues to ensure sustainable and equitable economic progress.

It might surprise casual listeners that perennial frat-bar favorite John Mellencamp is a longtime supporter of liberal politics: He’s lent campaign tunes to Hillary Clinton and asked John McCain to stop using them, is a cofounder of Farm Aid, and left his old record label Columbia after encountering an executive who made racist remarks about black musicians.
Mellencamp brought his political views to the forefront during a recent performance on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert.
The rock icon delivered a powerful rendition of his classic hit, "Pink Houses," with a twist.
As the song drew to a close, Mellencamp took one knee and raised a fist, echoing the silent protest that swept the NFL after Colin Kaepernick began kneeling during the national anthem in 2016.
Watch the performance below.
The Tokyo Olympic marathon is set to commence and conclude at the newly constructed National Stadium, marking a significant milestone in the upcoming games.
The decision to have both the start and finish lines at the stadium adds a unique element to the race, allowing athletes to showcase their skills in a state-of-the-art sports facility.

The marathon route, which traditionally winds through the city streets, will now see participants running through various iconic landmarks in Tokyo before heading back to the National Stadium for the grand finish.
This change in the route is expected to provide spectators with a more centralized viewing experience and create a memorable atmosphere for both athletes and fans alike.
Organizers said the original bid had the marathon scheduled to start at 7:30 am to avoid Tokyo's summer heat and humidity.
Tokyo spokesman Masa Takaya said a confirmed starting time was expected to be announced in July at a meeting of the International Olympic Committee's executive board.
Las Vegas Metro police said they arrested a 62-year-old man in connection with a ‘threatening note” that was found at Sen. Dean Heller’s office in July.
Richard Holley was arrested for extortion, burglary and intimidating a public officer, police said.
He was taken into custody without incident on Monday.
The note, which was discovered by a staffer, contained menacing language and prompted an immediate response from law enforcement.
Investigators worked diligently to track down the suspect, leading to Holley's apprehension.
Authorities have not disclosed the specific details of the threat or the motive behind it.
Sen. Heller's office expressed gratitude for the swift action taken by law enforcement and reassured the public of their safety.
Holley is currently being held pending further investigation and legal proceedings.
The owners of the Ligue 1 club FC Girondins de Bordeaux are reportedly in advanced talks over selling the club to an American investment fund.
The club is currently under majority ownership of the M6 media group, the parent company of the French television channels M6 and W9.
The potential sale has garnered significant interest within the football community and among Bordeaux fans.

The American investment firm, whose name has not been disclosed yet, is known for its involvement in sports ventures, sparking curiosity about the future direction and potential investments in the club.

If the deal goes through, it would mark a significant shift in ownership for FC Bordeaux, with the American investors likely to bring in a fresh perspective and potentially significant financial resources to bolster the club's operations and competitiveness.
Sources close to the negotiations suggest that the sale could be finalized in the coming weeks, pending regulatory approvals and finalization of terms.
The move comes at a crucial time for FC Bordeaux, as they aim to strengthen their position in Ligue 1 and potentially expand their global reach.
Fans and stakeholders eagerly await further details on the potential sale and the strategic vision that the American investment firm may have for FC Bordeaux.
The outcome of these discussions could reshape the future trajectory of the historic French football club.
DAYTON, Ohio (WDTN) – Premier Health is inviting students to a career exploration event.
Local high school students will learn about careers in health care at Premier Health’s MedQuest event.
The event aims to provide students with insights into various healthcare professions and the potential career paths available in the industry.
Scheduled to take place next month, the MedQuest event will feature interactive sessions, workshops, and presentations by healthcare professionals from Premier Health facilities.
Students will have the opportunity to engage with doctors, nurses, technicians, and other healthcare experts to gain a deeper understanding of the diverse roles within the field.
Premier Health is committed to fostering the next generation of healthcare professionals and hopes to inspire students to pursue careers in the healthcare industry.
This event underscores the organization's dedication to supporting education and career development within the local community.
GREEN BAY, Wis. — Allie LeClaire scored 22 points, Jessica Lindstrom added 19 and No.
20 Green Bay women's basketball team managed to hold off Wright State in a thrilling 75-68 victory.
The game was a close contest from start to finish, with both teams showcasing their skills on the court.
Green Bay took an early lead in the first half, but Wright State fought back hard, keeping the score tight throughout the game.
LeClaire's impressive performance, including clutch baskets and crucial free throws down the stretch, helped secure the win for Green Bay.
Lindstrom also played a vital role in Green Bay's victory, contributing both offensively and defensively.
Her strong presence in the paint and ability to hit key shots kept the momentum in Green Bay's favor.
Despite a resilient effort from Wright State, Green Bay's tenacity and skill proved to be the difference in the end.
The win improves Green Bay's record and solidifies their position as a top team in the conference.
The victory was a testament to Green Bay's teamwork and determination, setting a positive tone for the rest of their season.
Actress and TV personality Candace Cameron Bure recently shared her recipe for a delicious low-calorie vegan Caesar salad, perfect for those looking for a healthy and satisfying meal option.
Known for her commitment to a healthy lifestyle, Bure's recipe is not only nutritious but also packed with flavor.
The vegan Caesar salad features a homemade dressing made with ingredients like Dijon mustard, nutritional yeast, hummus, garlic, lemon juice, soy sauce, olive oil, and cayenne pepper.
This flavorful dressing pairs perfectly with fresh kale and other salad ingredients, creating a vibrant and nutrient-rich dish.
For those interested in trying out this recipe at home, here is the ingredient list for the vegan kale Caesar salad dressing: 1 1/2 tbsp.
Dijon mustard, 1 1/2 tbsp.
nutritional yeast, 1 tbsp.
hummus, 3 cloves garlic (minced), 1/4 c. water, juice of 1 lemon, 2 tsp.
soy sauce, 1 tbsp.
extra-virgin olive oil, and 1/4 tsp.
cayenne pepper.
Enjoy this healthy and flavorful salad option!
Vegan Kale Caesar Salad For the Dressing 1 1/2 tbsp.
Dijon mustard 1 1/2 tbsp.
nutritional yeast 1 tbsp.
hummus 3 cloves garlic, minced 1/4 c. water Juice of 1 lemon 2 tsp.
soy sauce 1 tbsp.
extra-virgin olive oil 1/4 tsp.
cayenne pepper For the Salad

LIVERPOOL, England — Liverpool manager Juergen Klopp says Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain likely sustained a “really bad” injury in the 5-2 win over Roma in Champions League on Tuesday, potentially jeopardizing his chances of playing in the World Cup for England.
The midfielder was forced off the pitch in the 18th minute after a collision with Roma's Aleksandar Kolarov.
Klopp expressed concern over the severity of the injury, stating that it "doesn't look good" for Oxlade-Chamberlain.
The 24-year-old had been enjoying a resurgence in form and had become an integral part of Liverpool's midfield before this setback.
His dynamic playing style and work rate will be sorely missed by the team as they approach the crucial stages of the Champions League and Premier League.
With the World Cup in Russia just around the corner, England manager Gareth Southgate will be closely monitoring Oxlade-Chamberlain's situation.
The news of his potential absence from the tournament will undoubtedly be a blow to both the player and the national team as they aim to make an impact on the global stage.

Neilson Barnard/Getty Images(NEW YORK) — An extended trailer for Carpool Karaoke: The Series, a standalone show based on James Corden’s popular Late Late Show segment is available on YouTube, and features previously unreleased footage with Will Smith, among others.
In the clip, Smith and Corden rap the theme from Smith’s 1990s sitcom The Fresh Prince of Bel Air.
Other scenes include the two performing “Gettin’ Jiggy wit It,” accompanied by a marching band, and singing R. Kelly’s “I Believe I Can Fly” in a helicopter.

The trailer also features R& B artists John Legend and Alicia Keys singing with a choir in a laundromat; Billy on the Street‘s Billy Eichner and rockers Metallica leading supermarket shoppers and employees in the band’s “Enter Sandman”; country star Blake Shelton and talk show host Chelsea Handler in a bar belting out a drunken version of Bon Jovi’s “Livin’ on a Prayer”; and wrestler John Cena and seven-foot former pro basketball player Shaquille O’Neal hillariously trying to squeeze into a tiny car.
Pop superstar Ariana Grande and Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane and Good Morning America co-host Michael Strahan and race car driver Jeff Gordon also show up in the video.
The trailer promises a star-studded lineup and a lot of fun and unexpected moments as celebrities let loose and showcase their singing skills in the confined space of a car.
Carpool Karaoke has become a viral sensation, with Corden driving around with famous guests, singing along to popular songs, and engaging in entertaining conversations.

Fans of the original Carpool Karaoke segment on The Late Late Show can look forward to a longer format and more elaborate productions in Carpool Karaoke: The Series, which is set to premiere on Apple Music.

(LOS ANGELES) — We finally have our first real look at Venom, Sony Pictures’ take on the shape-shifting Marvel Comics anti-hero.

The first trailer shows Mad Max and The Dark Knight Rises star Tom Hardy as dogged reporter Eddie Brock, who in the course of tracking down a story about a company dabbling in human experimentation becomes infected with a mysterious black goop that’s actually an alien life form.

This so-called symbiote gives Brock superhuman powers, and can transform him into the hulking, titular black anti-hero creature that made its first appearance in the pages of The Amazing Spider-Man comic back in the ’80s.
The trailer teases fans with glimpses of Hardy's portrayal of Eddie Brock, a character known for his complex moral struggles and eventual transformation into the formidable Venom.

With intense action sequences and dark, atmospheric visuals, the footage showcases the symbiote's menacing power and Brock's internal battle as he grapples with his newfound abilities and the symbiote's influence.
Fans of the Marvel Comics universe are eagerly anticipating Hardy's portrayal of this iconic character, and the trailer hints at a thrilling and visually stunning cinematic experience.
"Venom" is set to bring a fresh and intriguing take on the anti-hero genre, promising a dark and gripping narrative that will captivate audiences when it hits theaters.
MOGADISHU, Somalia (AP) — Fighting continued through the night as Somalia's al-Shabab Islamic extremists fought off heavily armed soldiers in a bloody siege at a popular Mogadishu restaurant.
Extremist snipers fired on security troops who surrounded the restaurant building and used big guns mounted on the backs of vehicles to neutralize militants.
Soldiers entered the ground floor while the insurgent attackers held positions upstairs.
As the hours passed, the intensity of the battle escalated, with gunfire and explosions echoing through the city streets.
The sound of sirens wailed in the background as emergency services rushed to the scene to tend to the wounded.
The standoff between the militants and the security forces raised concerns about the safety of civilians caught in the crossfire.
The roofs were blown off the Pizza House restaurant and nearby buildings from the powerful blasts.
High casualties are feared in the attack on the busy restaurant.
Police said the bodies of five girls thought to have been killed by militants were found in the restaurant.
Arsenal manager Unai Emery revealed Calum Chambers would be part of his plans in 2018-19 after the defender signed a new long-term contract at the club.
Chambers, 24, has been with the Gunners since 2014, having joined from Southampton.
The English defender spent the 2018-19 season on loan at Fulham, where he gained valuable experience in the Premier League.
Emery expressed his satisfaction with Chambers' commitment to the club, highlighting his versatility and defensive qualities.
The Spaniard sees Chambers as a valuable asset who can contribute significantly to Arsenal's defensive solidity in the upcoming season.
With competition for places in defense heating up, Chambers' new deal signals Emery's confidence in his abilities to perform at the highest level.
Emery told the club's official website: "I'm delighted Calum has extended his stay with us.
"He played an important role last season and will be part of my plans this season."
TORONTO (AP) — Prince Harry says his late mother drew a spotlight to causes and issues that didn't get attention.
Now he's following in her footsteps as he promotes the Invictus Games for wounded veterans.
The 32-year-old prince said in an excerpt of an interview with Canada's CTV television network that Diana would put everybody before herself.
During the interview, Prince Harry emphasized the importance of shining a light on the challenges faced by veterans and the healing power of sports.
He highlighted the upcoming Invictus Games, an international sporting event for wounded, injured, and sick servicemen and women.
The prince expressed his admiration for the resilience and determination shown by the competitors, noting that their stories inspire others to overcome adversity.
Prince Harry's dedication to honoring his mother's legacy through charitable work continues to make a positive impact on the lives of veterans and their families.
Prince Harry believes in his relationship with Meghan Markle so much, he’s reportedly rejected the idea of having a prenuptial agreement ahead of their marriage.

A source allegedly told TheDailyMail, “He’s determined that his marriage will be a lasting one, so there’s no need for him to sign anything.” Harry is following in the footsteps of his older brother William, who also refused to sign a prenup.
The royal couple plan on getting married in May.
The decision not to have a prenup has sparked discussions among royal watchers and legal experts.
Some view it as a romantic gesture that shows Harry's commitment to Meghan, while others express concern about the financial implications in case of a divorce.
Despite the lack of a formal agreement, both Harry and Meghan seem confident in their love and the future of their marriage.
Their decision reflects a belief in the strength of their relationship and a focus on building a life together based on trust and mutual respect.
A rate hike is likely coming to Canada this summer.
The Bank of Canada announced this morning the interest rate would remain at 1.25 per cent, but with the rise in inflation, led by gas prices, analysts believe a hike could be coming in July.
The price of crude is on the rise again, which helped the TSX break a five-day losing streak.
The Bay Street index opened higher and is up to 15,963.
Experts say supplies are dwindling with no action from world producers despite promises to increase production to offset losses from Venezuela and Iran.
Investors are closely watching the developments in the energy sector as crude oil prices continue to climb, providing a boost to the Canadian stock market.
The positive momentum in the energy sector has also been supported by geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, contributing to the overall bullish sentiment in the market.
Analysts are optimistic about the outlook for the Canadian economy, citing strong economic indicators and robust consumer spending.
However, concerns remain about the potential impact of trade tensions and uncertainty surrounding global economic growth.
Market participants are advised to remain vigilant and monitor the evolving situation closely to make informed investment decisions.
In a bid to resolve the ongoing political crisis in Guinea-Bissau, the United Nations has emphasized the urgent need for dialogue and negotiations among all parties involved.
The UN stressed that a peaceful and inclusive solution is vital to ensure stability and progress in the country.
Guinea-Bissau has been plagued by political instability for decades, with frequent coups and countercoups disrupting governance and hindering development efforts.
The international community is calling on all stakeholders to prioritize the interests of the nation and its people above personal or partisan agendas.
Efforts to initiate talks and foster reconciliation are crucial steps towards establishing a sustainable political framework that upholds democracy and the rule of law in Guinea-Bissau.
The UN stands ready to support and facilitate the dialogue process to help the country overcome its longstanding challenges and build a brighter future for its citizens.
Guinea-Bissau has had so many coups and countercoups that no elected leader has been able to complete his term since the country won independence from Portugal in 1974.
CLEVELAND (AP) — Authorities say two children and two adults are unaccounted for after an overnight house fire in Cleveland.
The blaze broke out late last night in a residential neighborhood, engulfing the home in flames before firefighters could contain it.
Emergency responders arrived quickly on the scene, but the intensity of the fire made it difficult to enter the building.
Investigators say a 4-year-old boy, an 8-year-old girl, their father and another man are missing.
Firefighters say the blaze caused severe damage, hindering their ability to search the charred home.
There was no immediate word on what caused the fire.
The state fire marshal's office will help investigate.
EATON, Ohio (AP) — Court records show that an Ohio man who told police he killed his son with a hatchet during a confrontation has been charged with aggravated murder.
Fifty-eight-year-old Gabriel Schaaf, of Lewisburg, is scheduled for an initial appearance Wednesday in Eaton Municipal Court.
He also faces a tampering with evidence charge.
Schaaf was arrested last week after investigators found his DNA beneath 29-year-old Jonathan Schaaf’s fingernails.
Authorities in Preble County said the incident occurred at the family's home, where Gabriel allegedly attacked his son with a hatchet following a heated argument.
The tragic event has shocked the local community, with neighbors expressing disbelief over the violent nature of the crime.
Investigators are working to uncover the motive behind the disturbing act, as family and friends mourn the loss of Jonathan Schaaf.
The case continues to unfold as authorities seek justice for the victim and answers for the grieving loved ones left behind.
TEMPE, Ariz. — Police in a Phoenix suburb say one of Uber’s self-driving vehicles has struck and killed a pedestrian.
Police in the city of Tempe said Monday that the vehicle was in autonomous mode with an operator behind the wheel when the woman walking outside of a crosswalk was hit.
The incident has raised concerns about the safety of autonomous vehicles and their ability to accurately detect and respond to unexpected situations on the road.
This tragic event marks a significant setback for Uber's self-driving car program, which has faced scrutiny in the past over safety issues.
Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the accident to determine the exact cause and any potential negligence involved.
The victim's identity has not been released, pending notification of her family.
This incident underscores the ongoing challenges and ethical considerations surrounding the integration of self-driving technology into our everyday lives.
Apparently, it’s never to early to launch a strike in the Los Angeles Lakers’ Troll Wars.
On Monday, ahead of a game against the Indiana Pacers at Bankers Life Fieldhouse, rookie Kyle Kuzma stretched the boundaries of battle into breakfast.
Kuz hopped on Instagram to capture Zo using a napkin as a plate, while the 20-year-old point guard used a proper plate to eat his bacon and eggs.
“This dude ain’t got no house manners,” Kuzma lamented.
The Crown Prince of Chino Hills protested, going so far as to bang on his plate to prove Kuzma wrong.

The Troll Wars, a friendly competition to one-up each other with humorous jabs and pranks, have become a part of the team culture.

As the Lakers continue to bond both on and off the court, the Troll Wars serve as a reminder of the team's chemistry and unity.
Despite the competitive nature of the NBA, moments like these highlight the friendships and connections that extend beyond the game.
The European Union is facing mounting pressure to revise the Iran nuclear deal amid concerns about the security implications of sticking to the current agreement.
Despite growing calls for amendments to the pact, EU officials are hesitant to reopen negotiations, fearing that doing so could unravel the fragile diplomatic progress achieved thus far.

High Representative Federica Mogherini emphasized the need to address Iran's missile development and destabilizing activities in the region but maintained that these issues should be dealt with separately from the existing nuclear agreement.
The EU's stance reflects a delicate balancing act between upholding the terms of the deal and addressing broader security challenges posed by Iran's actions.
Mogherini says the EU hopes to dissuade Iran from developing missiles or undermining regional security, but that work must happen "outside the scope of the nuclear agreement."
FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. — A federal judge has overturned a jury decision that found a former president of Bolivia and his defence minister responsible for government killings during 2003 unrest.
The ruling came as a surprise to many, as the original verdict had sparked widespread controversy and protests.
The judge cited lack of sufficient evidence and procedural errors during the trial as reasons for the decision to overturn the jury's verdict.
The former president, who has maintained his innocence throughout the legal proceedings, expressed relief at the judge's decision.
Supporters of the ex-president hailed the ruling as a victory for justice and vowed to continue fighting against what they perceive as politically motivated charges.
The case has reignited debates about accountability and the rule of law in Bolivia, with many questioning the fairness of the legal system.
Sleaford First XI came agonisingly close to winning at second-placed Grantham on Saturday, eventually losing the Lincs ECB Premier League fixture by just a single run.

Grantham batted first after winning the toss but after a solid start, some determined bowling saw the innings interestingly poised at 126-5 with Andrew Jones and Adi Sreedharan each claiming two victims.
Home captain Daniel Webb helped his side post a competitive total, supervising the rest of the innings with an important knock of 66 to take the hosts to 224 from their allotted overs.

At 90-4 in Sleaford’s reply the game was in the balance, but a stand between Andy Hibberd and Shaun Morris swung the game in favour of the visitors who took themselves to within 18 runs of victory with five wickets in hand.
But Sleaford finished just short of the target despite Hibberd’s contribution of 93.
* In the South Lincs and Border League Premier, Sleaford Seconds took maximum points against Frieston to stay top.
Batting first, Sleaford posted 201-7 with Charlie Roberts (67) the principal contributor.
The visitors never threatened in reply and were all out for 74, with spinners Angus Youles, Sumit Puri and Ben Hutson claiming eight wickets between them.
The narrow defeat for the First XI will be a tough pill to swallow, especially after coming so close to a remarkable victory.
However, the team's fighting spirit and resilience showcased in this match bode well for their upcoming fixtures.
The performance of the Second XI further highlights the depth and talent within the Sleaford Cricket Club, with both teams showing their quality in their respective leagues.
As the season progresses, Sleaford will look to build on these positive displays and continue their pursuit of success in both the Premier League and the Border League.
POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. — Takal Molson and Jermaine Crumpton posted double-doubles and Canisius used a late surge to take a 73-67 victory over Marist on Friday night.

Molson had 21 points and 10 rebounds and Crumpton 18 points and a career-high 16 boards for the Golden Griffins (14-9, 8-2 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), who bounced back from a loss to Niagara to win for the fifth time in six starts.
Isaiah Reese added 21 points.
In a closely contested game, Canisius found themselves trailing 62-63 with just over two minutes left on the clock.
However, a resilient effort from Molson, Crumpton, and Reese saw the Golden Griffins go on an impressive 8-0 run to secure the victory.
Their strong defensive play and clutch shooting down the stretch proved to be the difference-maker as they pulled away in the closing moments.
An 8-0 spurt extended the Griffins’ lead to 71-62 with 37 seconds remaining.
Marist outshot Canisius 53 to 35 per cent but had 24 turnovers.
Brian Parker scored 19 points with 11 rebounds for Marist, his first double-double this season.
Israeli media is reporting that police are expected to question Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on a pair of corruption allegations.
This development comes as the latest in a series of legal troubles for the long-serving Prime Minister.
The allegations involve suspicions of bribery and fraud, adding to the existing charges of corruption that Netanyahu is already facing.
The police are said to be investigating claims that Netanyahu received expensive gifts from wealthy associates and engaged in quid pro quo deals for favorable news coverage.
Netanyahu has consistently denied any wrongdoing and has dismissed the allegations as politically motivated attacks.
The questioning by the police signals a significant escalation in the legal challenges facing the Prime Minister, who is also facing a tough political landscape with a fragile coalition government.
Netanyahu's supporters have rallied behind him, while his opponents are calling for his resignation.
The outcome of this investigation could have far-reaching implications for Israeli politics.

WARSAW, Poland (AP) — Poland's Senate has backed legislation regulating Holocaust speech that has sparked a diplomatic dispute with Israel and calls from the United States for a reconsideration of a bill seen as threatening freedom of speech.

The bill, which criminalizes accusing the Polish nation of complicity in Nazi crimes, has been met with criticism for potentially stifling open discussion about Poland's role in World War II atrocities.
Supporters argue that the law is necessary to protect Poland's reputation and ensure historical accuracy, while opponents fear it could lead to censorship and distort the truth.
The controversial legislation has strained relations between Poland and Israel, with the Israeli government strongly opposing the bill.
Israel views it as an attempt to downplay the involvement of some Poles in the persecution of Jews during the Holocaust.
To become law, the bill requires approval from the president, who supports it.
Israel sees the move as an attempt to whitewash the role some Poles played in the killing of Jews during World War II.
A signed copy of Adolf Hitler's Mein Kampf is set to go under the hammer in the Ribble Valley, sparking both curiosity and controversy.
The rare item, bearing the infamous dictator's signature, has garnered attention due to its historical significance and dark provenance.
The book, Mein Kampf, which translates to My Struggle, was penned by Hitler in 1925 and outlines his radical political beliefs and ambitions for Germany.
This particular copy is believed to be a unique find as Hitler was notoriously averse to signing documents.
It holds a chilling allure for collectors and historians alike, offering a tangible link to one of the most malevolent figures in modern history.
The signed edition of Mein Kampf has a fascinating provenance, having been acquired by former BBC and Oxford Mail journalist Peter Cadogan during a visit to Munich in the late 1930s.
The book will be auctioned at Silverwoods auction house on Lincoln Way, with estimates suggesting it could fetch over £1,000.
While some recoil at the notion of owning Nazi memorabilia, others argue for its preservation as a cautionary reminder of the past.
It was presented to former BBC and Oxford Mail journalist Peter Cadogan during a visit to Munich in the late 1930s.
It will be sold at Silverwoods auction house on Lincoln Way and is expected to raise more than £1,000.
Auctioneer James Thompson said some people "wouldn't touch anything Nazi with a bargepole", but others believe the book should be preserved, despite Hitler's appalling reign.
"In a way, it's a way to touch a monster," he added.
Mein Kampf, which translates as My Struggle, was first published in 1925 and sets out Hitler's political ideology and plans for Germany.
The example being sold is thought to be especially rare because Hitler was known to resist signing documents of any kind.

Both Target Center and U.S. Bank Stadium have played integral roles in shaping Minnesota's sports landscape and attracting top-tier sporting events to the region.
The nomination for Sports Facility of the Year highlights their impact on the local community and the broader sports industry.
Fans and stakeholders eagerly await the announcement of the winner, recognizing the hard work and dedication put into these exceptional venues.

President Duterte on Monday issued interim appointments to four of his Cabinet members who have yet to be confirmed by the powerful Commission on Appointments.

They are Environment Secretary Gina Lopez, Agrarian Reform Secretary Rafael Mariano, Health Secretary Paulyn Ubial, and Social Welfare Secretary Judy Taguiwalo, according to the Office of the Executive Secretary.
The interim appointments come amidst the ongoing deliberations and scrutiny by the Commission on Appointments, which has the authority to confirm or reject the President's appointees.
These interim appointments will allow the secretaries to continue carrying out their duties and responsibilities within their respective departments while awaiting confirmation.

The four secretaries have been instrumental in implementing key policies and programs in their respective areas, and their continued tenure will ensure continuity and stability in the government's initiatives.

The decision to issue interim appointments underscores the administration's commitment to ensuring the smooth functioning of key government agencies despite the challenges of the confirmation process.

Mississippi businesses are emphasizing the importance of having well-educated workers, according to Secretary of State Delbert Hosemann.

In a recent survey conducted by his office, Hosemann found that over 5,300 out of nearly 100,000 businesses in the state responded, with a majority being small businesses with fewer than 50 employees.
The survey revealed that businesses are looking for employees with a strong work ethic, honesty, and excellent communication skills.
Interestingly, state and local tax incentives were not high on the list of priorities for these businesses.
Instead, more than 400 of the respondents expressed interest in collaborating with elementary and secondary schools, community colleges, and universities to ensure a well-educated workforce.
Secretary of State Delbert Hosemann’s office sent questionnaires to almost 100,000 businesses that are registered in Mississippi.
He says Tuesday that more than 5,300 of them responded, and most of the answers came from businesses with fewer than 50 employees.
Many of those answering the survey say that a strong work ethic, honesty and strong communications skills are the top traits they want in their workers.
Hosemann says state and local tax incentives rated relatively low on the list of priorities from businesses that responded.
He says more than 400 businesses requested information about how they can work with elementary and secondary schools, community colleges and universities.
Ramen is quickly becoming one of America's favorite comfort foods, and probably even one of yours.
While traditional ramen can be delicious, it's often loaded with sodium and unhealthy fats.
Luckily, there are ways to enjoy this beloved dish in a healthier manner.
Here are five better, healthier bowls of ramen you can make tonight.
**Veggie-Packed Ramen**: Load up your ramen with a variety of colorful vegetables like bell peppers, carrots, and spinach.
Not only does this add a nutritional boost, but it also makes your bowl more visually appealing.
**Miso Ramen**: Swap out the traditional broth for miso broth, which is lower in sodium and adds a rich umami flavor.
Top it with tofu, seaweed, and green onions for a satisfying meal.
**Chicken and Mushroom Ramen**: Use lean chicken breast and flavorful mushrooms to create a hearty ramen bowl.
The combination of protein and fiber will keep you full and satisfied.
**Spicy Shrimp Ramen**: Add a kick to your ramen with spicy shrimp.
Shrimp is a good source of protein and pairs well with the heat from chili peppers.
**Soba Noodle Ramen**: For a twist, use soba noodles instead of traditional ramen noodles.
Soba noodles are made from buckwheat and offer a nutty flavor along with added fiber and nutrients.
By trying out these variations, you can enjoy a comforting bowl of ramen without sacrificing your health goals.
Give one of these recipes a try tonight and elevate your ramen game!
Liverpool will face Hoffenheim in their Champions League clash without the services of key players Philippe Coutinho and Daniel Sturridge.

WASHINGTON (AP) — The IRS says it’s following President Donald Trump’s executive order on health care by easing enforcement of the unpopular Obama-era requirement for people to have coverage or risk fines.
This move comes as part of the ongoing efforts to dismantle key aspects of the Affordable Care Act, commonly known as Obamacare.
The IRS announced that it will no longer reject tax returns that do not indicate whether the filer had health coverage, marking a significant shift in enforcement.
Critics of the ACA view this decision as a step towards unraveling the healthcare law, while supporters express concerns about the potential consequences on the stability of the insurance market.
Despite the change in enforcement, the IRS emphasizes that the coverage requirement remains in effect.
But the IRS says it will keep processing such returns, as it has in the past.
Many of the law’s supporters consider the coverage requirement essential for nudging younger, healthy people into the insurance pool to keep premiums in check.
The IRS says the requirement is still the law.

At the heart of the turmoil is Elsa, Lauri's mother, whose world has been turned upside down by the violent attack on her son.
Desperate for answers and struggling to cope with her emotions, Elsa finds herself thrust into the role of a grieving mother seeking justice for her son.

“I want my company to innovate, but I am not convinced we can execute successfully.” Far too many times I have heard this fear expressed by senior executives that I have met at different points in my career.

In fact, a recent study published by Price Waterhouse Coopers found that while 93% of executives depend on innovation to drive growth, more than half are challenged to take innovative ideas to market quickly in a scalable way.

At the recent AWS re:Invent conference, Amazon Web Services (AWS) made a series of announcements aimed at addressing these challenges and boosting enterprise innovation, particularly for businesses using Windows environments.
One of the key highlights was the introduction of AWS Proton, a new service designed to help companies adopt modern development practices and technologies more easily.
Proton streamlines the process of deploying and managing infrastructure for container and serverless applications, enabling organizations to innovate faster and more efficiently.
In addition, AWS also unveiled Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus, a monitoring service that simplifies the setup and management of Prometheus for monitoring containerized applications.
This new offering further enhances the observability and operational efficiency of Windows workloads running on AWS.

Furthermore, AWS announced the availability of Amazon ECS Anywhere and Amazon EKS Anywhere, enabling customers to run Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) and Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) on their own infrastructure.
This flexibility empowers organizations to innovate on their terms while leveraging the scalability and reliability of AWS services.
Overall, the announcements made at AWS re:Invent demonstrate a commitment to empowering enterprises to accelerate innovation and drive growth, particularly for those utilizing Windows environments.
By providing tools and services that simplify and enhance the development process, AWS is enabling businesses to overcome the challenges of bringing innovative ideas to market quickly and at scale.

In a shocking incident at the Khao Yai national park in Thailand, a French tourist was bitten by a crocodile while attempting to take a selfie.
The 47-year-old woman, identified as Muriel Benetulier, ignored warning signs and got too close to the crocodile, resulting in the unfortunate attack.
Park officials reported that the crocodile bit Benetulier on the leg, causing significant injury.
Local media images captured the dramatic scene of park rangers carrying the victim on a stretcher, her knee wrapped in a thick bandage.
The area where the incident occurred was marked with a sign warning of the danger of crocodiles and no swimming.
Siamese crocodiles, once abundant in Southeast Asia, have faced severe population declines due to hunting and habitat destruction.
They are now classified as critically endangered on the IUCN's red list, with only a few remaining wild populations in Thailand's national parks.
The crocodile bit 47-year-old Muriel Benetulier on the leg when she ignored warning signs and approached it to take a selfie, park officials said.
The incident took place at the Khao Yai national park, three hours north of Bangkok.
Local media posted pictures of park rangers dressed in camouflage carrying the victim strapped to a stretcher, a thick bandage around her knee.
Another photo showed a ranger pointing to a pool of blood close to a sign saying in Thai and English "Danger Crocodile No Swimming".
Siamese crocodiles were once ubiquitous across South East Asia but their populations have been decimated in the last century by hunting and habitat loss.
They are currently listed as critically endangered on the IUCN's red list.
In Thailand there are just a handful of wild populations left in central and western national parks.

BERLIN (AP) — More than 100 outfits created by Gianni Versace from the 1970s to the 1990s are going on show in Berlin, some 20 years after the designer's death.

Organizers of the "Gianni Versace Retrospective" exhibition opening Tuesday at the German capital's Kronprinzenpalais put together the show with contributions from private collectors around the world.
The exhibition showcases Versace's iconic designs, known for their bold colors, luxurious fabrics, and daring cuts that revolutionized the fashion industry.
Visitors will have the opportunity to admire Versace's signature flamboyant style and innovative approach to fashion, which continues to influence designers today.
Co-curator Karl von der Ahe said the show stemmed from a chance meeting with a major Versace collector, which generated a desire to "show the breadth of the work."

The exhibition runs until April 13.

ISTANBUL (AP) — The waters around Istanbul have turned a striking shade of turquoise.
A natural phenomenon called a "phytoplankton bloom" has turned the normally dark waters of the Bosporus and Golden Horn into an opaque tone of light blue.
It's caused by microscopic organisms that have inundated the Black Sea, just north of Turkey's largest city.
This sudden change in color has captivated locals and tourists alike, with many flocking to the shores to witness the mesmerizing sight.
Experts explain that the phytoplankton responsible for the bloom are single-celled algae that thrive in nutrient-rich waters.
The recent warm weather and calm seas have created ideal conditions for these organisms to flourish, leading to the spectacular transformation of the coastal waters.
While the vibrant turquoise hue may be visually stunning, experts assure the public that the phytoplankton bloom poses no threat to human health.
In fact, these microscopic organisms play a vital role in the marine ecosystem, serving as the base of the food chain and contributing to the overall health of the aquatic environment.
As the bloom gradually dissipates, the waters are expected to return to their normal color, leaving behind a memorable spectacle for those who witnessed nature's unexpected display in Istanbul.

In a dramatic turn of events, a suspect driving on flat tires led Kansas police on a heart-pounding two-hour chase through city streets and highways.
The pursuit, which began in the early hours of the morning, saw the suspect weaving in and out of traffic at high speeds, narrowly avoiding collisions with other vehicles.
Officers deployed spike strips in an attempt to stop the suspect's vehicle, but the determined driver continued to evade capture, driving on rims as sparks flew from the worn-out tires.
Despite the challenging conditions, law enforcement officers managed to maintain visual contact with the suspect throughout the pursuit.
Finally, the chase came to an end when the suspect's vehicle came to a stop due to the extensive damage caused by driving on flat tires.
Officers swiftly apprehended the driver, identified as John Gage, and conducted a search of the vehicle.
Officers found drugs and three loaded weapons in the vehicle.
Gage was taken to a hospital because officers believe he ingested several grams of methamphetamine prior to the arrest.
The suspect faces a slew of charges, including drug possession, weapons offenses, and reckless driving.
The Kansas police department commended the officers involved in the pursuit for their professionalism and dedication to ensuring the safety of the community.

In a shocking incident, a woman was shot dead inside a police station in Mainpuri district of Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday morning.
According to sources, the victim had gone to police station to lodge a complaint in a land dispute case and suddenly five men barged into the police station and one of them fired at her.
The woman was immediately taken to the hospital where she was declared brought dead.
The police have launched an investigation into the matter and are looking into the possible motives behind the heinous crime.
The incident has sparked outrage in the local community, with many demanding swift justice for the victim.
The Chief Minister has taken cognizance of the matter and has directed the police to expedite the investigation and ensure that the culprits are brought to justice.
The tragic incident has once again highlighted the need for better security measures in police stations to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future.
Reports emerging from Istanbul suggest that the Islamic State (IS) may be responsible for the horrific attack on the Reina nightclub.
The gunman, who remains unidentified and at large, carried out a brutal assault that claimed the lives of 39 innocent individuals.

Hurriyet and Karar newspaper reports Monday cited unnamed security officials saying that authorities have determined that the gunman who killed 39 people comes from a Central Asian nation and is believed to be either from Uzbekistan or Kyrgyzstan.
Police had also established similarities with the high-casualty attack at Ataturk Airport in June and was investigating whether the same IS cell carried out both attacks.
The gunman, who is still at large, killed a policeman and another man outside the Reina club in the early hours of 2017 before firing at people partying inside.
Nearly two-thirds of the dead were foreigners, many from the Middle East.

Mid-morning fire guts Enterprise house A fire of unknown origin yesterday destroyed a two-storey concrete house in Section ‘C’ Enterprise, East Coast Demerara, and a family of four is now counting their losses.
The fire reportedly started around 11:00 hrs as smoke was seen emanating from the upper flat.
Residing at the house were 46-year-old Devon Angoy, his wife, Adele Frank-Angoy and their two children, who are 22 and 19 respectively.
Persons became aware of the blaze after smoke was seen billowing from within.
Firefighters rushed to the scene and battled the fierce flames for several hours, but unfortunately, the fire had already engulfed the entire structure.
Neighbors gathered outside, offering support to the devastated family as they watched their home and belongings consumed by the fire.
The community has rallied together to provide temporary shelter and assistance to the Angoy family during this difficult time.
Nothing could be saved.
Meanwhile, fire officials are investigating to determine the cause.
In a recent development, the 2nd District Court of Appeal has deemed the questioning of Joshua James Corbett, the accused stalker of actress Sandra Bullock, as unlawful.
Corbett, who was arrested in June 2014 inside Bullock's home and charged with felony stalking, had his rights violated during a police interrogation.
The court ruled that detectives overstepped boundaries by disregarding Corbett's right to remain silent and conducting an unlawful search of his residence.
Although Corbett was unarmed during the intrusion at Bullock's residence, a subsequent search of his home uncovered multiple automatic weapons and illegal tracer ammunition.
Despite this, a judge from the Los Angeles Superior Court dismissed the evidence supporting the weapons charges last year.
The decision was based on the determination that Corbett did not provide consent for the search of his home.

The 2nd District Court of Appeal ruled Tuesday that police detectives violated Joshua James Corbett's rights to remain silent during a police interrogation, and his right against an unlawful search of his home.
Corbett was arrested in June 2014 inside Bullock's home, and he has been charged with felony stalking.
Corbett was unarmed at the Oscar winner's home, but police later found several automatic weapons and illegal tracer ammunition in his home.
A Los Angeles Superior Court judge threw out evidence supporting the weapons charges last year after determining Corbett didn't give officers permission to search his home.

The federal government is reevaluating Ontario's allocation of climate funding as a result of recent political changes in the province.

The $420 million designated for Ontario through the Low Carbon Economy Leadership Fund is now in question due to Ontario Premier Doug Ford's decision to eliminate the cap and trade program established by the previous Liberal government.
This move has significant implications, as the funding provided to provinces is linked to their commitment to implementing carbon pricing mechanisms outlined in the federal framework.
Environment Minister Catherine McKenna's spokeswoman has confirmed that Ontario's share of the $1.4-billion climate change fund is under review following Ford's policy changes.
The decision to rescind the cap and trade program has prompted the federal government to halt the flow of funds to Ontario until the province aligns with the carbon pricing requirements.

This development underscores the challenges of coordinating climate action efforts between different levels of government and highlights the complexities of addressing environmental issues on a national scale.

A spokeswoman for Environment Minister Catherine McKenna says the $420 million earmarked for Ontario under the Low Carbon Economy Leadership Fund is under review, since funding is contingent on agreeing to the framework, which includes imposing a carbon price.
Newly elected Ontario Premier Doug Ford has rescinded the previous Liberal government's regulation that established the cap and trade program in 2017.
That has prompted Canada to immediately hit the brakes on Ontario's portion of the $1.4-billion climate change fund.

“The new ‘A3 10’ is designed to provide our users with a complete immersive experience.

Pandora Premium has made its way to Xbox One, offering gamers a new way to enhance their gaming experience with personalized music streaming.
The integration of Pandora Premium on Xbox One brings a host of exciting features to the console, catering to the music needs of gamers and enhancing the overall entertainment experience.

The Xbox One version has a refreshed look, making it easier to navigate your music collection, and includes background audio support and an autoplay function that means you'll never be left sitting in silence when your gaming gets too intense to pause and find something else to listen to.
Xbox One fans don't have a huge amount of choice when it comes to on-demand background-streaming music services.
Since Groove -- which was first on the scene -- is no more, Pandora's main rival Spotify has taken the top spot.
Whether Pandora will overtake Spotify as the gamer's streaming service of choice is yet to be seen, but its arrival on Xbox One certainly increases competition between the two.
The arrival of Pandora Premium on Xbox One opens up a new world of music discovery and customization for gamers, offering a seamless way to enjoy their favorite tracks while immersed in gameplay.
With its user-friendly interface and extensive music library, Pandora Premium on Xbox One is set to revolutionize the way gamers interact with music while playing their favorite titles.
In a thrilling matchup between Milwaukee and Green Bay, the Panthers emerged victorious with a commanding 76-58 win, thanks to a stellar performance by Nze.
Nze put on a show, delivering a career-high performance with a game-high 23 points, leading Milwaukee to a dominating victory over their rivals.
From the opening tip-off, Nze set the tone for the Panthers, scoring the first six points of the game and propelling his team to an early lead.
Milwaukee never looked back, maintaining a double-digit lead for the entirety of the second half, showcasing their offensive prowess and defensive tenacity.
Despite a brief moment when Green Bay managed to trim the lead, Milwaukee quickly regained control and never relinquished their advantage.
Manny Patterson and Khalil Small tried to spark a comeback for the Phoenix, but the Panthers' relentless pressure proved too much to handle.
Milwaukee's victory was a testament to their collective effort, outscoring Green Bay in multiple facets of the game.
With this win, the Panthers improve to 15-11 overall and 10-4 in conference play, solidifying their position at the top of the standings.
Milwaukee led by double digits for the entire second half except once when the Phoenix (10-16, 5-8) trailed 34-25 on Khalil Small’s jumper in the first minute of the period.
Nze scored the first six points of the game and Milwaukee opened with an 8-0 run.
Green Bay took its only lead of the game at 13-12 before the Panthers went on an 8-0 run and never trailed again.
Manny Patterson had 13 points and Small scored 10 for Green Bay.
The Phoenix committed 20 turnovers and were outrebounded 38-29.

RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Former Brazil goalkeeper Julio Cesar says he will return to boyhood club Flamengo and end his career there in three months.
The 2010 Champions League winner with Inter Milan says "I hope I can enjoy those three months with the fans so we can close this chapter with a happy ending."
The 38-year-old Julio Cesar was a starter for Brazil at the last two World Cups.
Julio Cesar began his professional career with Flamengo in 1997 and went on to have a successful career in Europe, playing for clubs like Inter Milan, Benfica, and Queens Park Rangers.
Known for his shot-stopping abilities and leadership on the field, Julio Cesar is considered one of Brazil's greatest goalkeepers.
His decision to return to Flamengo, where he started his journey in football, has been met with excitement and nostalgia among fans.
Julio Cesar's experience and talent will undoubtedly be an asset to the team as they aim for success in the upcoming season.
In a disappointing turn of events for supporters of sports betting in Minnesota, the proposed Sports Betting Bill has failed to pass in the state's House.

The bill, which aimed to legalize sports betting in the state, faced opposition from lawmakers who raised concerns about the potential social and ethical implications of expanding gambling opportunities.
Proponents of the bill argued that legalizing sports betting would bring much-needed revenue to the state and regulate an industry that is currently operating underground.
However, opponents expressed worries about the impact on vulnerable populations and the potential for an increase in problem gambling.
Despite the setback, supporters of sports betting remain hopeful for future legislative efforts to legalize the practice in Minnesota.
The bill would have set up regulations for online fantasy sports betting.
It is not officially legal in Minnesota, but there’s no law against it either.

Tropical Storm Gert continues to strengthen in the Atlantic Ocean, with swells expected to soon begin affecting portions of the U.S. East Coast.
The National Hurricane Center said Gert was centered about 455 miles (735 kilometers) west-southwest of Bermuda Monday evening and had maximum sustained winds of 70 mph (110 kph).
It is moving north at 8 mph (13 kph).
Forecasters predict that Gert will intensify further as it moves northward, posing potential risks to coastal areas.
Residents along the U.S. East Coast are advised to closely monitor the storm's progress and take necessary precautions to ensure their safety.
The storm's impact is expected to be felt in the coming days, with rough seas and dangerous rip currents posing significant hazards to beachgoers and maritime activities.
A gradual turn toward the northeast with an increase in forward speed is forecast for Tuesday night.
Swells generated by Gert will begin to affect portions of Bermuda and the U.S. East Coast — from North Carolina to New York — over the next couple of days.
The Hurricane Center says these swells are likely to cause life-threatening surf and rip current conditions.

Prosecutors said evidence found at the crime scene was clearly matched to the arrested suspect.

“The MeshugaNutcracker!” is a full-length musical comedy that features the wonderfully silly sensibilities of the folklore of Chelm (a fictional town of fools) underscored by an invigorating Klezmer-ized orchestration of Tchaikovsky’s “Nutcracker Suite,” including original lyrics that celebrate Chanukah.

Judah Maccabee’s triumphant saga and accounts of perseverance during the Holocaust as well as the celebration of the first Chanukah in the new state of Israel emerge with a genuine sense of wonder as the Chelmniks tell eight stories that pay tribute to the holiday.
This unique production blends the classic tale of the Nutcracker with the rich traditions of Chanukah, creating a delightful and heartwarming experience for audiences of all ages.

The Chelmniks, with their humorous antics and endearing personalities, bring a fresh perspective to the holiday season, reminding us of the importance of laughter, resilience, and community in the face of adversity.
Through music, dance, and storytelling, “The MeshugaNutcracker!” captures the spirit of Chanukah in a way that is both entertaining and thought-provoking.

Audiences are taken on a journey that celebrates the miracles and traditions of the holiday, all set to a lively and engaging musical backdrop that is sure to leave everyone smiling and tapping their toes.
By Brian Ives So, you’re Mariah Carey, one of the world’s biggest stars for a quarter of a century, and you fail on national TV, big time.
How do you handle it?
As it turns out, you handle it with humor.
Following her now-infamous New Year's Eve performance in Times Square, Mariah Carey has shown the world that she can laugh at herself.
During her highly anticipated set on Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest, technical difficulties led to a less-than-ideal performance.
However, instead of dwelling on the mishap, Carey took to social media to share her lighthearted reaction.
In a tweet the following day, Carey quipped, "S*** happens.
Have a happy and healthy new year everybody!
Here's to making more headlines in 2017."
This self-deprecating response endeared her to fans and showcased her ability to handle setbacks with grace and humor.
Fans and critics alike applauded Carey for her resilience and positive attitude in the face of adversity.
Despite the challenges she faced during the live broadcast, Carey remained poised and embraced the moment with a sense of humor that resonated with many.
As one of the music industry's most enduring icons, Mariah Carey's ability to handle setbacks with humor and grace only further solidifies her status as a true professional and a beloved entertainer.
German bobsledder Johannes Lochner led a dominant performance by his team in the 4-man bobsled World Cup, securing a German sweep in the competition.

Lochner and his crew of Joshua Bluhm, Christopher Weber and Christian Rasp were quickest in both runs, clocking 1 minute 49.03 seconds — 0.23 ahead of Nico Walther’s team and 0.33 ahead of Francesco Friedrich’s.
Justin Kripps’ Canadian crew was fourth, ahead of compatriot Chris Spring and his team.
Lochner extended his lead after four events to 826 points, ahead of Walther on 787 and Kripps on 754.

Nando's “Just bring your results papers, ID and spend a minimum of seven pounds in any restaurant across the UK (excluding Scotland) and you will be eligible.

With the anticipation building up for A-level results day, Nando’s offer adds an exciting and tasty incentive for students to visit their nearest restaurant and savor the complimentary chicken.
Don’t miss out on this opportunity to enjoy a free meal courtesy of Nando’s as a well-deserved treat for your academic accomplishments.
YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio (AP) – A state prison will use equipment seized from an illegal marijuana grower to cultivate vegetables for poor people.
In a unique initiative aimed at giving back to the community, inmates will be trained to grow fresh produce using the confiscated pot-growing kit.
The program, set to launch next month, is part of the prison's efforts to promote rehabilitation and provide inmates with valuable skills they can use upon release.
Authorities hope that by channeling the expertise of these prisoners into a positive and productive venture, they can make a meaningful impact on food insecurity in the local community.
The vegetables grown will be donated to local food banks and shelters, helping to ensure that those in need have access to nutritious and fresh produce.
This innovative approach highlights the potential for positive outcomes when resources are repurposed for the greater good.
